title: `#[inline(never)]` does not work for async fn

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: AsyncAwait-Triaged
labels.description: Async-await issues that have been triaged during a working group meeting.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
#[inline(never)]
async foo() {
    // ...
}
```

https://rust.godbolt.org/z/97P1Goqhx

I expected to see this happen: logic code in async functions will not be inlined.

Instead, this happened: Only the function itself is not inlined, and the Future it returns is fully inlined.

I believe this is because async fn is desugared to

```rust
#[inline(never)]
fn foo() -> impl Future<Output = ()> {
    async move {
        // ...
    }
}
```

To get desired effect, I need to write

```rust
struct NoInline<F>(F);

impl<F: Future> Future for NoInline<F> {
    type Output = F::Output;

    #[inline(never)]
    fn poll(self: Pin<&mut Self>, cx: &mut Context<'_>) -> Poll<Self::Output> {
        // ...
    }
}

#[inline]
fn foo() -> impl Future<Output = ()> {
    async fn foo_inner() {
        // ...
    }
    NoInline(foo_inner())
}
```
